column4: Anyone that knows a good torrent prog that can be installed with sudo apt?
thers a dozen of them in the repos.
try 'nautilus .'  perhaps that will open the file manager to the current dir.
actually nautilus by itself may open the current dir.
try ctrl \ or ctrl-c or just enter,
ctrl + c worked fine. cheers man=)
you may of entered a single quote that was waiting for a finishing quote
i kinda exidently pressed alot of ottons:P
the other > ya saw is the 'continuation bash prompt' where its letting you enter more data for the earlier line.
check out the various bash docs/guides for more info. :)
oh, ok, kinda explains why its not that good to press to much bottons lol. thx for ctrl+c :)
if you have never used ctrl-c befor. :) you REALLY should spend an hr reading some bash/shell tutorials.
the bash shell! read up on it.. 'your patience will be rewarded' "_
im still kunda bothered writing "sudo apt-get install" insted of just yum lol. yeayh, i suppose i have to read that.. some day ;)
reading up on the apt-get docs/guides/tutorials should also be on your todo list.
its on my todo list also.
